nameEntry.part: Women's Place Women's Space Steering Committee

biogHist.abstract: The 'Women's Place Women's Space' steering committee was formed in 1989 with the aim of securing a building and funding to resource a women's centre in Brisbane; a building that would provide 'a space for women by women for women, in Brisbane'. An ex-director of the University of Queensland Health Service, Dr Janet Irwin, is credited with initiating the concept, which received the public support of 173 women's organizations, representing 200,000 women throughout Queensland. The then Lord Mayor of Brisbane, Sally Anne Atkinson, gave the proposal her strong support
biogHist.p: After the World Expo stage in Brisbane in 1988 was over, prominent Queensland feminists argued that the women of Queensland, whose millions of hours of unpaid labour had made the event such a success, should be offered a 'permanent thank you present'; an 'indestructable well done' in the form of a 'Women's space'. Initially, the concept built upon ideas that had been floated in the 1970s about the need for a National Women's Research Centre, along the lines of the model offered by the Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies (AIATSIS). The proposed 'Stockmen's Hall of Fame' was also a source of inspiration, with supporters arguing that 'women are equally (more) important than stockmen with their 'Hall of Fame'.

The steering committee decided upon the concept of a multipurpose centre, of which a 'Hall of Fame' that focused on the achievements of women in the public and private sector, would be just one section. As well as the 'Hall of Fame', which was not to get 'bogged down by an emphasis on inequalities and injustices', but was to illustrate 'the active role that women from a multiplicity of backgrounds have played or are playing in Australian society', the space would include a gallery area, an auditorium, meeting rooms, a board room and a library. It was envisaged that revenue could be raised by leasing other areas to suitable tenants, such as health professionals, child minding facilities and counseling services.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Soroptimist International of the South West Pacific (SISWP)

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Women's Place Women's Space Steering Committee', in The Australian Women's Register, National Foundation for Australian Women and The University of Melbourne

bibref.title: Women's Place Women's Space Steering Committee

resourceRelation.relationEntry: The Women's Community Aid Association (The Women's Centre in Brisbane)

archref.repository: John Oxley Library, Manuscripts and Business Records Collection, State Library of Queensland
archref.unittitle: The Women's Community Aid Association (The Women's Centre in Brisbane)
archref.abstract:
This small collection contains information about proposals made for the establishment of a Women's Resource and education Centre In Brisbane. The proposals include the aims of the centre; e.g. educational programs, legal, health, information and counseling services, estimates of expenditure, library stocks and necessary equipment.
The John Oxley Library is in temporary accommodation until 2006. Most material is kept off-site. Researchers wishing to use the manuscript collection should contact the research librarian prior to visiting the library to confirm the availability of the material.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Women's Place Women's Space Steering Committee Records

archref.repository: John Oxley Library, Manuscripts and Business Records Collection, State Library of Queensland
archref.unittitle: Women's Place Women's Space Steering Committee Records
archref.abstract:
This is a small collection of records relating to the push of various Queensland women's groups to build a women's centre in the city of Brisbane, Queensland. It includes a copy of the project proposal and design plans.
The John Oxley Library is in temporary accommodation until 2006. Most material is kept off-site. Researchers wishing to use the manuscript collection should contact the research librarian prior to visiting the library to confirm the availability of the material.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Soroptimist International, South Queensland Region Records

archref.repository: John Oxley Library, Manuscripts and Business Records Collection, State Library of Queensland
archref.unittitle: Soroptimist International, South Queensland Region Records
archref.abstract:
These records have been newly acquired (2004) by the Manuscript Collection at the John Oxley Library. The list below is incomplete and does not reflect the full extent of the collection. The collection contains business records, annual reports, miscellaneous correspondence for the constituent clubs for a period covering most of the 1980s and 1990s. It also includes information relating the governing federation, Soroptimist International of the South West Pacific (SISWP).
Box 1 (10321): South Pine club meeting minute books, 1979-1985. Record of federation policy -1986. Training manual (1996) detailing how to manage a club, membership and extension, how to apply for a grant, etc. SI SWP Headquarters - international circulars (1994)
Box 2 (10322): South pine records and letters South pine minutes 1985 -1995. South pine constitution Exec minute book 1982-84 Regional coordinator guide to duties. Accounts
Box 3 (10323) Various Business Records (1988-92)
Box 4 (10324) Records relating to the Brisbane club: minutes, treasurers reports, 1987 -1992. Newsletters, circulars, 1992-94, 1996 SISWP -guidelines and manusals 91-94.
Box 5 (10325) Miscellaneous recods 1995/96 Circulars, club returns, membership list, Brisbane annual report 1993
Box 6 (10326) Club reports (late 1980s and early 90s)from: Toowoomba, Gold Coast, Caboolture, Sunshine Coast, Beenleigh, Brisbane, Redland. Material relating to SISWP : reports, council meetings, conferences, World Span - comments on environmental matters and AIDS. General Correspondence. Material relating to Soroptimist International of North Queensland. Membership lists from the early 1990s. Correspondence from Fijian Soroptimists(probably Indo-fijian) after the coup in 1987. Documents relating to the the Queensland 'Women's Place, Women's Space' Campaign.
Box 7 (10327) Conference programs, accounts, 1994,98
Box 8 (10328)
Assorted SISWP records 1986-87. Material for the development of a history of Soroptimism in Queensland.
Box 9 (10329)
Brisbane papers 1990 Historical notes and Newspaper cuttings
The John Oxley Library is in temporary accommodation until 2006. Most material is kept off-site. Researchers wishing to use the manuscript collection should contact the research librarian prior to visiting the library to confirm the availability of the material.
